abstract: Web traffic late Thursday surged on the news of Michael Jackson’s hospitalization and death. Akamai said that traffic to news Web sites spiked around 6 p.m. Eastern, clocking in at one point at 4.2 million visitors per minute. During the rest of the day, the sites tracked by Akamai never exceeded 3 million visitors per minute.

lead_paragraph: Did your Internet connection seem slow Thursday afternoon? It very likely wasn’t your computer; it was the surge of interest in Michael Jackson’s hospitalization and death.

headline.main: With Jackson News, a Surge in Web Traffic

abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s embattled chief executive, retained the backing of a top lieutenant on Friday, when Brian T. Moynihan, the head of wealth management and investment banking divisions, called Mr. Lewis the “right person” to lead the nation’s largest bank.

lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s embattled chief executive, retained the backing of a top lieutenant on Friday, when Brian T. Moynihan, the head of wealth management and investment banking, called Mr. Lewis the “right person” to lead the nation’s largest bank.

headline.main: Lewis Retains Support of Key BofA Executive
